result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Evidentiary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:13 PM 
Defendant Nicholas Michael Gimino in court.  Attorney Brian P Dimmer in court for Nicholas Michael Gimino.  Attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Scheduling of Defendant's Motion for Penalty Determination and Defendant's Motion to Suppress is addressed. 

The Court directs ADA Shock to file response to Penalty Determination 
recess: 2:20pm
NEXT: Motion Hearing/Evidentiary Hearing on 11/7/22 at 3:00pm
Motion hearing on October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 2:24pm 
Defendant Nicholas Michael Gimino in court with Attorney Natalie Wisco. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Wisco indicates that Attorney Dimmer is anticipating the filing of a motion to suppress. 
Arguments are given on the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond to remove the Scram-monitoring condition of Bond. 
The Court denies the Motion. 
recess 2:27pm 

NEXT:  (1) a Defense Motion to Suppress is forthcoming; once filed, the Court intends to issue a briefing schedule and schedule an evidentiary hearing on the motion;  (2) Status Conference on October 6th at 2:00pm
Motion hearing on September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

NEXT:   Preliminary Hearing on May 19th at 8:45am
Status conference on April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JA Note to File: The Court approves the 4/5/22 request for adjournment; JA to reset.

Adjustment Number: 22A 071875,
Payable Number: 190483,
Receipt Number: 22R 005839,
Amount: $20.00
Status conference on April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

The above-named applicant is eligible for State Public Defender
representation. The eligibility determination was made on 3/14/2022. No attorney is
available to attend the hearing scheduled for 3/16/22 .
Status conference on March 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Conditions of this Bond include:
--maintain absolute sobriety 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
--the Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[ml] Case called at 1:31PM
[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Nicholas Michael Gimino appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def declined eval).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant advises that his income is such that he would not qualify for the Public Defender Office's services and would like to explore his private counsel options.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court tolls any pending time limits and sets this matter over for a Status of Counsel.

The Court requires a $2,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
--the Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

recess 1:36PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 03/16 at 1:15PM
